articles.description: Villanova snagged an immediate-impact point guard, albeit one with some lingering questions.
articles.headline: Scout's Take: ESPN 100 PG Jahvon Quinerly commits to Villanova

images.caption: New Jersey native Jahvon Quinerly is staying closer to home, picking Villanova.
images.name: Jahvon Quinerly (5) [576x324] - Copy

articles.description: Seth Greenberg explains why Collin Sexton's game will translate better in the NBA than Trae Young's.
articles.headline: Greenberg would take Sexton over Young for NBA

images.caption: Seth Greenberg explains why Collin Sexton's game will translate better in the NBA than Trae Young's.
images.name: Greenberg would take Sexton over Young for NBA

articles.description: Ever since his grandmother died, Chris Chiozza says he has been a different basketball player, honoring her memory with his play and commemorating her on his arm.
articles.headline: The story behind Chris Chiozza's favorite tattoo

images.caption: The portrait of his grandmother on his left shoulder is one of 11 tattoos Chris Chiozza wears.
images.credit: Kelly Streeter/University of Florida Athletic Association
images.name: Chris Chiozza [1296x1296]

images.caption: Florida beats Missouri on the road thanks to a last-second steal and basket by Chris Chiozza.
images.name: Chiozza literally steals game from Missouri

articles.description: Point guard Jahvon Quinerly, who is ranked No. 26 in the 2018 ESPN 100, has committed to Villanova. He decommitted from Arizona in October after originally pledging to the Wildcats in August.
articles.headline: Jahvon Quinerly, No. 26 in the 2018 ESPN 100, commits to Villanova

images.caption: Jahvon Quinerly, who committed to Villanova, is ranked No. 26 in the ESPN 100 for 2018.
images.name: Jahvon Quinerly [600x400] - Copy

articles.description: Steph Curry has eclipsed many records in the NBA, won two MVPs and two rings. Oklahoma G Trae Young keeps piling up the stat sheet and continues to draw comparisons to Curry's game. The question is can Young keep it up?
articles.headline: Can Young follow in Curry's footsteps?

images.caption: Steph Curry has eclipsed many records in the NBA, won two MVPs and two rings. Oklahoma G Trae Young keeps piling up the stat sheet and continues to draw comparisons to Curry's game. The question is can Young keep it up?
images.name: Can Young follow in Curry's footsteps?

articles.description: Trae Young discusses not finding his rhythm anywhere on the court and facing Texas Tech's defense.
articles.headline: Young: 'Got to improve and I will'

images.caption: Trae Young discusses not finding his rhythm anywhere on the court and facing Texas Tech's defense.
images.name: Young: 'Got to improve and I will'
